posts.author: Brutalix
posts.content: Hello all. I was wondering what would make for a better pure monk build on a low magic/pre epic server. Going dex or str build?

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Low Magic?

Can you get Monk Gloves with elemental damage on them?

If so, then I would definitely go Dex.

In this case, Dex with some Improved evasion, a dip in rog or ass to nail down the Dex AC, and the World is your oyster!  extra sauce for epic dodge, perhaps a bit of HiPS sprinkled in, delicious!

Why, perhaps go all in with some extra sr...ala my Deadly Nightshade build.

posts.author: Brutalix
posts.content: Thanks for the reply! The server I play on , big-time, limits what you can multi-class with monk. I'm pretty much limited to DD, WM, or divine champion. There are a few other, but by application only and I'd rather not bother with that. I do believe there are gloves with small elemental enhancements? I believe +4. Am I to believe if I went dex I would be going also weapon finese if I wanted to go with fists? If that were the case. Do I still want to place some into str for damage? Or keep it low and just pump up dex for ab/ac?

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
That changes things considerably!

Yes, it is weapon finesse for fists.  DD definitely, so you cannot be flanked and to help preserve Dex AC.  I would not skimp on Str, but it doesn't really need to be pumped.  Dex is your main here, followed by Wis because that AC cannot be lost.  Also, Monk +1/20 combines with DD dr (for normal weapons).

posts.author: Brutalix
posts.content: Monk +1/20? What does that mean?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
It's damage resistance. At level 20, a Monk successfully resists up to 20 points of damage from mundane weapons (those without enhancements). And don't forget a level 16 Monk gets d20 damage with their fists, so the strength becomes less of an issue.

I've done Monks/ Dwarven Defenders and Monks/ CoTs plenty of times (sometimes all three), both as strength and dexterity builds, some with kamas and some with fists. They can all work really well: it's all a question of getting to know how to play them differently.
